text: It appears that the current version of Node used to build projects on HubSpot after upload is v16.20. I cloned the cms-react repo and used Node v16.20 to do `npm i`. This generated a lot of package compatibility errors especially for Vite. I tried adding an `engines` entry to the package.json file with “>=18” to see if that would cause the upload build/deploy to use a different node version - it did not. It looks like LTS/gallium is no longer in “maintenance.” Is there a plan to upgrade the node version used to do builds?
Hello Rich - Thank for this feedback. We are in the process up updating both the build and runtime environments for CMS React to Node 20. I will update here when that is complete.
Rich - The build and runtime environments are now both on Node 20.

:wave: - Hello CMS React Devs!

:point_up: Rich's timing was spot on :sunglasses: . We have been working to move our Build and Run environments for CMS React to Node 20 in recent weeks. At this time the Build environment is now Node 20. Any new builds will also result in a Run environment which is Also Node 20. We do not anticipate this should cause the need for any change in how you all are developing, but as always please let us know of any issues you encounter.

Glad I could help! :smile:
Seriously - the team I’m working with has been impressed by the CMS-React framework HubSpot has built. A revamp of our corporate web page started a little after CMS-React was released and this has made it significantly easier and faster for us to make the changes. Keep up the great work!

What could be the cause if this error? (when building on a dev account)


> The build failed due to an internal error with id `9dfa2bca-277c-4f8b-9292-864fa8117c19`. Try uploading it again. If the problem persists, contact HubSpot support with the error id.
tried removing the app and creating it again, but error persists, but with a different id: c2a7f5ed-efea-47e2-8b6d-8999f9463b9b
More info on same project: It seems to be happening during `Building JS Custom Modules from module definitions`
